abstracts.cdata!:
The Provincial Agricultural Development
            Project is part of the modernization and decentralization
            efforts of the public administration which are being
            executed by the Government and the Provincial
            Administration.  Its main objective is to improve
            economically and environmentally the agro-fishery public
            services of the provinces, within the framework of a
            strategy of competitive production for internal and external
            markets.  This report contains a summary of the
            environmental impacts, both positive and negative, of the
            project on: 1) water resources; 2) vegetation; 3) livestock;
            4) neighboring roads; 5) land titling; 6) technology; and 7)
            water systems improvement.  The report also presents a brief
            description of the project and its components, as well as
            the general framework of its environmental assessment.
            Finally, the report reviews ways to mitigate the negative
            impacts of the project.
